customer_name: The Wyman Living History Ranch & Museum
site_name: The Wyman Living History Ranch & Museum

citations.narrative:
The only water receptacle available to the elk is full of green, murky water. You cannot see through the water and there
are green rafts of algae floating on top of the surface. Dirty water could make the elk reluctant to drink which could cause
dehydration. Dirty water could also be contaminated with organisms that could cause illness. The licensee must ensure
that all water receptacles be kept clean and sanitary. To be corrected by 7/10/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The only water receptacle available to the elk is full of green, murky water. You cannot see through the water and there 
are green rafts of algae floating on top of the surface. Dirty water could make the elk reluctant to drink which could cause 
dehydration. Dirty water could also be contaminated with organisms that could cause illness. The licensee must ensure 
that all water receptacles be kept clean and sanitary. To be corrected by 7/10/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
